frame.name: Medical_specialties
frame.definition: <def-root>This frame includes words that name medical specialties and is closely related to the Medical_professionals frame. The FE <fen>Type</fen> characterizing a sub-are in a <fen>Specialty</fen> may also be expressed. <ex>Ralph <gov>practices</gov> <x><fex name="Type">paediatric</fex> <fex name="Spec"><t>oncology</t></fex></x>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Specialty
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the medical <fen>Specialty</fen> that someone practices.
<ex>Ralph <gov>practices</gov> <x><t>paediatric</t> <fex name="Spec"><t>oncology</t></fex></x>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Body_system
FE.definition:
<def-root>The sub-part or sub-system of the body which is studied. This is normally incorporated in the LUs of the frame.
<ex>Dr. Steppenhame was a specialist in <fex name="bod">intestinal</fex> <t>epidemiology</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Affliction
FE.definition:
<def-root>The disease or disorder that a specialist attempts to treat. This concept is normally incorporated in the name of the <fen>Specialty</fen>.
<ex>She briefly worked as <fex name="aff">diabetic</fex> <t>endocrinology</t> intern.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: cardiology.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the branch of medicine concerned with diseases and abnormalities of the heart

lexUnit.name: dentistry.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the science concerned with the diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of the teeth, gums, and related structures of the mouth and including the repair or replacement of defective teeth

lexUnit.name: dermatology.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the branch of medicine concerned with skin disorders

lexUnit.name: endocrinology.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the branch of physiology and medicine concerned with endocrine glands and hormones

lexUnit.name: epidemiology.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the branch of medicine concerned with the incidence and distribution of diseases and other factor relating to health.

lexUnit.name: gastroenterology.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the branch of medicine which deals with disorders of the stomach and intestines

lexUnit.name: gynaecology.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the branch of physiology and medicine concerned with the functions and diseases specific to women and girls, especially those affecting the reproductive system

lexUnit.name: haematology.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the science encompassing the medical study of the blood and blood producung organs

lexUnit.name: chiropractic.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a system of complementary medicine based on the diagnosis and manipulative treatment of misalignments of the joints, especially those of the spinal column

lexUnit.name: histology.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the branch of biology concerned with the microscopic structure of tissues

lexUnit.name: homeopathy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a system of complementary medicine in which disease is treated by minute doses of natural substances that in a healthy person would produce symptoms of disease

lexUnit.name: allopathy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the treatment of disease by conventional means, i.e. with drugs having effects opposite to the symptoms

lexUnit.name: midwifery.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the thechniques and practice of a person trained to assist women in childbirth

lexUnit.name: psychotherapy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the treatment of mental disorder by psychological rather than medical means

lexUnit.name: psychoanalysis.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a system of psychological theory and therapy which aims to treat mental disorders by investigating the interaction of conscious and unconscious elements in the mind and bringing repressed fears and conflicts into the conscious mind

lexUnit.name: immunology.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the branch of medicine and biology concerned with immunity

lexUnit.name: neonatology.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the branch of pediatric medicine that deals with the diseases and cure of newborn infants

lexUnit.name: nephrology.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the science that deals with the kidneys, especially their functions and diseases

lexUnit.name: neurology.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the branch of medicine and biology concerned with the nervous system

lexUnit.name: obstetrics.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the branch of medicine that deals with the care of women during pregnancy, childbirth, and the recuperative period period following delivery

lexUnit.name: oncology.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the study and treatment of tumours

lexUnit.name: orthopaedics.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the branch of medicine concerned with the correction of deformities of bones or muscles

lexUnit.name: paediatrics.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the branch of medicine concerned with children and their diseases

lexUnit.name: podiatry.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the branch of medicine that deals with the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of the human foot

lexUnit.name: radiology.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the science of X-rays and other high-energy radiation, especially as used in medicine

lexUnit.name: rheumatology.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the medical science that deals with the study of rheumatic diseases

lexUnit.name: medicine.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the science or practice of the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease.

lexUnit.name: therapy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: treatment intended to relieve or heal a disorder.

lexUnit.name: speech therapy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: treatment to help people with speech and language problems.
